SENT.plain: Recent studies in mouse, involving the Î²-cell-specific deletion of Dicer1, have highlighted the crucial role of miRNAs (microRNAs) in regulating insulin secretion and consequently Type 2 diabetes
Identifying the individual miRNAs involved in human islet dysfunction may be of diagnostic and therapeutic interest
miRNA expression profiling of human islets isolated from donors with and without Type 2 diabetes may represent one of the first steps in the discovery of these specific miRNAs
The present review discusses some of the potential pitfalls and promises of such an approach
